Package org.junit.jupiter.api

Annotation Type EnabledIf


  • @Target({TYPE,METHOD})
@Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@API(status=EXPERIMENTAL,
     since="5.1")
public @interface EnabledIf
    @EnabledIf evaluates a script controlling that the annotated test class or test method is currently enabled or disabled.

    The decision is made by interpreting the return value of the script:

    • true - if and only if the String-representation of the returned value is parsed by Boolean.parseBoolean(String) to true.
    • ConditionEvaluationResult - an instance of ConditionEvaluationResult is passed directly to the Jupiter engine.

    When this annotation with a script that evaluates to false is applied at the class level, all test methods within that class are automatically disabled as well.

    Script engine

    The default script engine is: Oracle Nashorn. The engine() property overrides the default script engine name.

    Bindings

    An accessor value provides access to a map-like structure.

    The following System property accessors are available:

    • systemEnvironment - System environment accessor.
    • systemProperty - System property accessor.
    The following Jupiter extension context-aware bindings are available:
    • jupiterTags - All tags as a Set<String>.
    • jupiterDisplayName - Display name as a String.
    • jupiterUniqueId - Unique ID as a String.
    • jupiterConfigurationParameter - Configuration parameter accessor.
    Since:
    5.1
    See Also:
    ScriptEngine, ExecutionCondition, ConditionEvaluationResult.enabled(String), ConditionEvaluationResult.disabled(String)

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.String[] value
      The lines of the script controlling the enabled or disabled state.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.String engine
      Short name of the ScriptEngine to use.
      java.lang.String reason
      The reason this test is enabled or disabled.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        java.lang.String[] value
        The lines of the script controlling the enabled or disabled state.

      • engine

        java.lang.String engine
        Short name of the ScriptEngine to use.

        Oracle Nashorn is used by default interpreting JavaScript scripts.

        Until Java SE 7, JDKs shipped with a JavaScript scripting engine based on Mozilla Rhino. Java SE 8 instead ships with the new engine called Oracle Nashorn, which is based on JSR 292 and invokedynamic.

        Returns:
        script engine name
        See Also:
        ScriptEngineManager.getEngineByName(String), Oracle Nashorn
        Default:
        "nashorn"

      • reason

        java.lang.String reason
        The reason this test is enabled or disabled.

        Defaults to: "Script `{script}` evaluated to: {result}"

        • {annotation} the String-representation of the @EnabledIf annotation instance
        • {script} the script text that was evaluated
        • {result} the String-representation of the result object returned by the script
        Returns:
        reason message
        See Also:
        ConditionEvaluationResult.getReason()
        Default:
        "Script `{script}` evaluated to: {result}"
